resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/104831</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>104831</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206970</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Fort Hancock: A Bastion of America's Eastern Seaboard</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Fort Hancock: Eine Bastion von Amerikas 
östlicher Meeresküste</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Fort Hancock : Une bastion du littoral 
oriental de l'Amérique</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Fort Hancock: Um bastion do seaboard 
oriental de América</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Hancock forte: Un bastion del litorale 
orientale dell'America</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Οχυρό hancock: Ένας προμαχώνας της ανατολικής
ακτής της Αμερικής</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Fortaleza Hancock: Un bastión del litoral 
del este de América</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">is a lesson that uses this fort, built in the late 1800s to defend New York Harbor, as the basis for examining issues in U.S. defense policy and military preparedness during that time.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Social Sciences</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">ist eine Lektion, die dieses Fort benutzt, 
aufgebaut im späten 1800s, um New York Hafen, als die Grundlage für 
überprüfende Ausgaben in der VEREINIGTE STAATEN Verteidigungpolitik 
und in der militärischen Bereitschaft während dieser Zeit zu 
verteidigen.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">est une leçon qui utilise ce fort, établie vers 
la fin de 1800s pour défendre le port de New York, comme base pour 
les issues examinantes dans la politique de la défense des ETATS-UNIS
et l'état de préparation militaire pendant ce temps.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">é uma lição que use este fort, construída no 
1800s atrasado para defender o porto de New York, como a base para 
edições examinando na política da defesa de ESTADOS UNIDOS e no 
preparedness militar durante esse tempo.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">è una lezione che usa questo forte, 
costruito verso la fine di 1800s per difendere il porto de New York, 
come la base per le edizioni esaminanti nella politica della difesa 
degli STATI UNITI e nella preparazione militare durante quel tempo.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">είναι ένα μάθημα που χρησιμοποιεί αυτό το οχυρό, που
χτίζεται προς το τέλος 1800s για να υπερασπίσει το λιμάνι της 
Νέας Υόρκης, ως βάση για τα ζητήματα στην πολιτική ΑΜΕΡΙΚΑΝΙΚΉΣ 
υπεράσπισης και τη στρατιωτική προπαρασκευή κατά τη διάρκεια 
εκείνου του χρόνου.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">es una lección que utiliza esta fortaleza, 
construida en el último 1800s para defender el puerto de Nueva York, 
como la base para las ediciones que examinan en la política de la 
defensa de ESTADOS UNIDOS y el estado de preparación militar durante 
ese tiempo.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sozialwissenschaften</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les Sciences Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciências Sociais</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienze Sociali</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Κοινωνικές επιστήμες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencias Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206970</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>104831</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/fort-hancock-a-bastion-of-americas-eastern-seaboard</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
